app.name: GVM
app.one_liner: A programming language version manager that supports multiple languages with both CLI and TUI interfaces.

screens.name: Terminal UI
screens.purpose: Provide an interactive interface to manage installed and remote language versions, set defaults, and switch contexts.

rust_commands.name: install
rust_commands.purpose: Install a specific version of a supported programming language.

rust_commands.name: ls
rust_commands.purpose: List installed versions of a language.

rust_commands.name: ls-remote
rust_commands.purpose: List remotely available versions of a language.

rust_commands.name: ui
rust_commands.purpose: Launch the terminal user interface for interactive management.

rust_commands.name: uninstall
rust_commands.purpose: Uninstall a specific version of a supported programming language.

rust_commands.name: use
rust_commands.purpose: Set the default version of a language for the current environment.

mvp_plan: week 1: Build basic TUI screen for language version management
week 1: Implement core CLI commands: install, uninstall, ls, ls-remote, use
week 1: Integrate with remote version sources for Go, Node, Java, Python
week 1: Persist installed versions and default selections to local state
acceptance_tests: Shell autocompletion works for all top-level GVM commands
User can install and uninstall Go version 1.25.0 via CLI
User can launch TUI and switch default Java version interactively
User can list installed and remote versions for Node.js
